text.name: sys_description
text.text: Microsoft's Xbox is a video game console released in the United States on November 15, 2001. Microsoft is taking its first steps in this sector, after having collaborated with Sega to bring Windows CE to Dreamcast and after having developed for several years Microsoft Game Studios games and SideWinder video game accessories for PC. It is equipped with an Intel Pentium III processor clocked at 733 Mhz, 128 KB of cache memory supported by 64 MB of RAM and an Nvidia 233 Mhz GPU which is in fact a modified GeForce 3 allowing it to display games in 720p and 1080i.
